first film on this list is 2015's sports
drama creed shot by cinematographer
maurice alberti this marks the seventh
installment in the rocky franchise and
is a sequel to 2006's rocky balboa this
one stars michael b jordan as adonis or
donny creed apollo creed's son who died
before donnie was born but boxing is in
donny's blood and he eventually seeks
out the training help of retired champ
rocky balboa with sylvester stallone
reprising the iconic role and also
writing all of his own scenes the film
which also includes tessa thompson and
felicia rashad in supporting roles
reunites jordan with writer and director
ryan coogler after working with him on
2013's fruitvale station and before
teaming up again for black panther in
2018 and landing her skills behind the
camera was french cinematographer
maurice alberti known for films like
2016's collateral beauty and 2008's the
wrestler the latter of which also made
this list maurice turned heads after
filming an entire two-round boxing match
as a single take at one point during
creed with no tricks or edits she later
said to the shot quote i think you don't
need to rely on movie editing to dictate
emotion
come on

the film was released on the 40th
anniversary of the opening scene in
1976's rocky and became a full circle
event when stallone was nominated for
the oscar for best supporting actor for
create his first nomination since the
original rocky the success of this
spin-off led to a sequel creed 2
released in 2018 to critical and
commercial success and creed 3 with
michael b jordan making his directorial
debut is scheduled for release late in
2022. and critics thought this certified
fresh installment was a knockout with
the consensus that creed brings the
rocky franchise off the mat for a
surprisingly effective seventh round
that extends the boxer saga in
interesting new directions while staying
true to its classic predecessor's roots

ruthless competitors who are jealous of
the new blood plus she has to deal with

known for films like 2019's honeyboy and
2014's the rover breyer brought a unique
approach to this project that included
smearing the lens with grease from her
own unwashed hair to get the right look
for a scene she went on to win best
cinematography awards from multiple
festivals and outlets including the
fright meter awards and danish film
awards and while the movie is coming in
rotten on the tomato meter critics like
candace frederick from real talk online
recognized briar's skills saying quote
the photography is stunning but the
story is a hot mess with an overall
consensus from critics that the neon
demon is seductively stylish but that
can't quite compensate for an
underdeveloped plot and thinly written
characters

2017's mudbound shot by cinematographer
rachel morrison this historical drama
was directed and co-written by d reese
and is based on the 2008 hillary jordan
novel of the same name it stars carrie
mulligan and garrett headland with a
supporting cast that includes jonathan
banks jason clark and mary j blige the
film is set in the rural american south
during world war ii and follows two
families bound together by their shared
farmland of the mississippi delta but
the mcallen family city transplants not
prepared for the harsh life of farming
and the jackson family long-time
sharecroppers who've worked the land for
generations are pitted against each
other by the social hierarchy of the jim
crow south this is made even more
complicated when sons from both families
return home from the war having forged a
friendship mudbound was a big hit on the
awards show circuit and pulled in four
oscar nominations including best
cinematography where rachel morrison
became the first woman ever nominated in
the category morrison who got her start
shooting shows like the hills and
working on various oprah specials has
since made quite the name for herself
with this film and others like 2013's
fruitvale station and 2018's black
panther i mean not a bad resume

this is a groundbreaking film critics
had plenty to praise in the certified
fresh gem with ao scott from the new
york times saying that morrison's
camerawork quote brings the soil the
flora and the weather to life in a way
that emphasizes the archaic elemental
power of the story while the overall
consensus from critics is that quote
mudbound offers a well-acted finely
detailed snapshot of american history
whose scenes of world class struggle
resonate far beyond their period setting

shot by cinematographer maurice alberti
directed by darren aronofsky this film
is about aging wrestler randy the ram
robinson played by mickey rourke who is
well past his prime but still trying to
make it happen on the pro wrestling
circuit but after taking a rather tense
beating in the ring he decides to hang
up his boots and ends up pursuing a
serious relationship with an aging
stripper played by marissa tomei he also
tries to reconnect with his estranged
daughter played by evan rachel wood but
finds himself missing the ring and
starts dreaming up a comeback realizing
that life in and out of the ring is a
struggle filming for the wrestler took
about 40 days in the winter of 2008
taking place mostly in new jersey and
new york with some scenes shot at the
2300 arena in philadelphia and doing the
heavy lifting behind the camera was
maurice alberti who picked up an
independent spirit award for best
cinematography for this film look at me

movie i mean isn't that sweet the film

that hunt using sound with the slightest

of course things are made even more

evelyn is pregnant and about to give

kristensen is best known for her work on
2016's fences and the girl on the train
the latter of which also starred emily
blunt and she knocked out filming over
the course of just 36 days in upstate
new york during 2017. the result was a
film that became a massive success
pulling in 350 million dollars worldwide
and paving the way for a sequel a quiet
place too released in 2021 with
krazynski returning to direct and the
main cast coming back plus the additions
of cillian murphy and dishman hansu

the consensus that quote a quiet place
artfully plays on elemental fears with a
ruthlessly intelligent creature feature
that's as original as it is scary

next up on this list of the most
beautiful movies shot by women is 2020's
mulan shot by cinematographer mandy
walker in this film yifei lou stars as
mulan the eldest daughter of hua zhao as
her family and community face the threat
of northern invaders in china she defies
both tradition and the law by disguising
herself as a male warrior in order to
serve in the imperial army taking the
place and hoping to save her ailing
father this film is a live-action
adaptation of disney's 1988 animated
film of the same name which itself is
based on the chinese folklore story
ballad of mulan by the way ming na wen
the original voice of mulan in the
animated film and other projects makes
the cameo in this film as well and
bringing that animated classic to actual
life was australian cinematographer
mandy walker a one-time cinematographer
of the year at the hollywood film awards
she's best known for her work on such
projects as 2016's hidden figures and
nicole kidman's australia in 2008 and
filming mulan was a global effort for
walker beginning in august of 2018 with
stops in places like new zealand and
china among others before rapping in
late november i can't believe all this
time you've been keeping your skill a

following ava duvernay's wrinkle in time
in 2018. with a scheduled release in
march of 2020 that was forced to be
canceled this film was one of the
biggest casualties of the coven 19
shutdown at the box office it was
eventually released in september on
disney plus for a premium fee with oscar
noms for costume design and visual
effects the consensus from critics was
that this film could have told its
classic story with greater depth but the
live-action mulan is a visual marvel
that serves as a stirring update to its
animated predecessor the little hours

label you felon you can't vote or get a
job and now the ninth film we're going
to discuss from this list is 2016's 13th
shot by cinematographer kira kelly this
documentary was directed by ava duvernay
and is titled after the 13th amendment
to the constitution which was adopted in
1865 and abolished slavery throughout
the united states in this film durenay
explores the history of racial
inequality in the united states with the
idea that slavery has been perpetuated
since the end of the civil war she
explores the suppression of african
americans by things like
disenfranchisement lynchings and how
politicians declared a war on drugs that
weighs more heavily in minority
communities the doc also looks at the
prison system from once enabling police
to arrest poor free men and forcing them
to work for the state under convict
leasing to the emerging detention
industrial complex and how much money is
being made by corporations from these
incarcerations duvernay turned to a
familiar face to work behind the camera
and cinematographer kira kelly now kelly
has worked on duvernay series queen
sugar is part of a resume that also
includes issa rae's series insecure as
well as landing her camera op skills to
2021 chung chi and the legend of the ten
rings in many ways the so-called war on
drugs was a war on
communities of color a war on black
communities the war on latino
communities duvernay and kelly put forth
an eye-opening film that earned an
academy award nomination for best
documentary and won the prime time emmy
award for outstanding documentary or
non-fiction special and critics praised
13th as well with nell minau from the
alliance of women film journalists
saying that this fierce and fearless
documentary is so brilliantly
constructed that its message is
inspiring as well as infuriating with an
overall critic's consensus it says 13
strikes at the heart of america's
tangled racial history offering
observations as incendiary as they are

movies shot by women is the 2018 crime

julie kirkwood this one stars nicole
kidman as aaron bell former undercover
police officer who as a young cop
infiltrated a gang in the california
desert but with tragic results when the
leader of that gang suddenly reemerges
years later aaron begins seeking out
revenge against his former associates to
try and bring him to justice and make
peace with her tortured past the cast
also includes toby kebbel tatiana
maslany scoop mcnary bradley whitford
and sebastian stan but it was kidman who
took center stage despite battling the

into a character so intense that kidman
said it took months to get it out of her
system along with director karen kusama
helping bring the story to the big
screen was cinematographer julie

destroyer hit theaters on christmas day
in 2018 and despite failing to recoup
its estimated 10 million budget at the
box office critics were into this
certified fresh flick sandra hall from
the sydney morning herald praised
kidman's collaboration with karen kusama
as another example of her willingness to
back a filmmaker still to pee and the
overall consensus with critics is that
the film's grueling narrative is as
uncompromising as kidman's central
performance which adds extra layers to a
challenging film that leaves a lingering
impact alright friends that is our list
of the most beautiful movies shot by
